official-title.#text:
To establish the Commission on America and its
		  Veterans.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a
			 period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for
			 consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the
			 committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

quote.#tail:
(referred to in this
			 Act as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Commission on America and its Veterans
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on America and its Veterans

text.#text:
There is
			 established an independent commission in the executive branch to be known as
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: finds the following:

text.#text:
After more than a
			 decade of war, and much work to help members of the Armed Forces returning home
			 from the battlefield, the United States needs a wider and more thorough process
			 for welcoming members back, taking care of their needs, and reintegrating them
			 into society.

Many initiatives
			 exist that provide help for the men and women who have fought, but there are
			 gaps in our support for veterans that need to be addressed.

The United States
			 has waged wars, but not all are involved in fighting those wars, and the United
			 States needs to be more deeply and regularly connected with members and their
			 experiences in war and returning from war.

Veterans
			 contribute mightily to the society of the United States but many veterans
			 endure ongoing psychological trauma, challenges with employment, crime and
			 dislocation, and veterans’ families and communities are also faced with the
			 after-effects of war in ways that need to be publicly addressed.

The Nation needs a whole-of-society
			 approach to improving the veteran’s position in society, and improving how we
			 welcome veterans when they return, and improving veterans’ experience when they
			 come back, and do so in a way that helps veterans, their families, and their
			 communities.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on America and its Veterans

a report suggesting ceremonies and events to be held

			 injuries paid by members, families, and communities;
